snippet: A 7.35-carat diamond that was in the possession of a New Jersey family for nine years had actually been stolen from a jeweler in 2003 by a stylist who pawned it.
abstract: Michael Wilson Crime Scene column on unpleasant surprise for New Jersey family when they discovered that 7.35-carat diamond they owned for a number of years had been stolen from a jeweler in 2003 and pawned by stylist Derek Khan; Gemological Institute of America, a nonprofit industry group that appraises and certifies diamonds, has current possession of the stone and says it will not return it until its rightful ownership can be determined.
lead_paragraph: A 7.35-carat diamond that was in the possession of a New Jersey family for nine years had actually been stolen from a jeweler in 2003 by a stylist who pawned it.

headline.main: Hot Ice: The Tortuous Tale of the Pear-Shaped Diamond
headline.print_headline: Hot Ice: The Tortuous Tale of the Pear-Shaped Diamond
